text.name: sys_description
text.text: The SAM Coupe is a British 8-bit personal computer released in 1989 and manufactured by Miles Gordon Technology (MGT). It is equipped with a Z80B processor clocked at 6 Mhz, 512 KB of RAM max internally and 4 MB externally. It offers 6-channel stereo sound over 8 octaves and you can integrate a 3 1/2 inch floppy disk drive. It has four graphics modes with 256x192 pixels in 16 colors and 512x192 pixels in 4 colors. It is also ZX Spectrum 48K compatible to enlarge its toy library, but released too late at the same time as 16-bit computers.
